purpose.summary: To protect freshwater wetlands in NJ by controlling activities that may alter or destroy them.

definitions.freshwater_wetland: An area saturated enough to support hydrophytic vegetation, based on hydrology, soils, and vegetation.
regulated_activity: Cutting vegetation that alters wetland character
definitions.transition_area: Land adjacent to wetlands minimizing adverse impacts or serving as a part of the ecosystem

permitting.requirement: Permit required for regulated activities unless exempt.

process.letter_of_interpretation: Available to determine if site is a wetland

exemptions: Normal farming/ranching on pre-1988 farmed wetlands

exceptional_value: Wetlands that discharge into FW-1, FW-2 trout production waters
Habitat for endangered or threatened species
classification.ordinary_value: Man-made or isolated wetlands not fitting other criteria

violations: Criminal penalties for false statements or reckless violations
Recording of violations on property deeds
